history.content: It’s obviously your call since you know your studying habits better than anyone else does, but I’d probably advise you to swap out one 161/186 for either 54 or 16B. 161 and 186 both have pretty heavy projects, and it would be pretty intense for most people to take them at the same time. Also, if you’re weaker on problem set-based classes and math/theory, I’d probably avoid grouping two such classes at once like you would have to with 54 and 16B. Furthermore, taking one of 54/16B before the other would probably help quite a bit with the other.

children.subject:
Ah sorry, I misinterpreted what you said and assumed you only had two semesters left. 100 is lighter, but 161 and 186 are pretty heavy (though not at the tier of like, 162, 164, 170, and 189). I would still recommend avoiding grouping two project-heavy classes instead of doing a pset-based class + a project-based class—I would certainly say that 54 has a much lower workload compared to either 161 or 186.

FWIW, I think 161 > 186 and 16B > 54 in terms of workload, so you could probably switch out 161 for 54 and be left with 54, 100, and 186, which I think is super manageable as far as 3 tech schedules go.
Hmm thanks, I'll have to think about it. I've just been traumatized by pset classes like 70, ee16a so I've been putting off 54 and 16b. I guess I'll see if 186 is partner proj or not.
I have another year after this so I could take 54 and 16b in separate semester. I heard 161 and 186 and 100 are lighter so I thought I could group them

186 is known to be a higher workload class mainly due to it's projects. It is highly likely that you will find yourself in situations where projects in 161 and 186 will overlap or be very close to each other. In any case I agree with the student answer since you may want to spend some time finding an internship. I would recommend math 54 since it will help you in 16B later on and give you appropriate time to leetcode.

history.content: I'm still trying to find an internship so I'm wondering what people think of this schedule. 186, data 100, and 161? I need to take 3 techs in one of my semesters left with only m54 and ee16b remaining from lowerdiv. I also am quite bad at problem set classes or math/theory heavy stuff. I don't mind pnp either to focus on leetcode engineering
history.subject: realistic workload?
